alert.note: Alert for Morris (New Jersey) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly (New Jersey, Delaware, Southeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued January 23 at 8:30PM EST until January 24 at 10:00AM EST by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 10 AM EST WEDNESDAY... * WHAT...Freezing rain. Additional ice accumulations of a light glaze. * WHERE...Morris. * WHEN...Until 10 AM EST Wednesday. * IMPACTS...Very slippery sidewalks, roads, and bridges are possible. The hazardous conditions could impact the morning commute. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Periods of light precipitation will continue to affect the area through tonight into Wednesday morning. While this may fall mainly as light rain over the lower elevations, a wintry mix can be expected at elevations above roughly 800 feet or so with freezing rain being the main hazard. All areas will then see a change to rain Wednesday morning as temperatures warm. Ice accumulation will vary with the potential for several hundredths of an inch over the higher terrain over the northwest part of the county with very little in the lower elevations farther south and east.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. Prepare for possible power outages. The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.
